comment: Ash is a close second to hickory for things like tool handles (hammers, axes, etc) & can be made into wooden joiners mallets, to name a few things off the top of my head. In any case, having a supply of straight grained hardwood around the homestead is never a bad idea. It would be interesting, but I probably wont do many windmill projects like suggested.
